text: As he walked along, he saw a man blind from birth.
His disciples asked him, &#34Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?&#34
Jesus answered, &#34Neither this man nor his parents sinned; he was born blind so that God&#39s works might be revealed in him.
We must work the works of him who sent me while it is day; night is coming when no one can work.
As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.&#34
When he had said this, he spat on the ground and made mud with the saliva and spread the mud on the man&#39s eyes,
saying to him, &#34Go, wash in the pool of Siloam&#34 (which means Sent). Then he went and washed and came back able to see.
The neighbors and those who had seen him before as a beggar began to ask, &#34Is this not the man who used to sit and beg?&#34
Some were saying, &#34It is he.&#34 Others were saying, &#34No, but it is someone like him.&#34 He kept saying, &#34I am the man.&#34
But they kept asking him, &#34Then how were your eyes opened?&#34
He answered, &#34The man called Jesus made mud, spread it on my eyes, and said to me, &#39Go to Siloam and wash.&#39 Then I went and washed and received my sight.&#34
They said to him, &#34Where is he?&#34 He said, &#34I do not know.&#34
They brought to the Pharisees the man who had formerly been blind.
Now it was a sabbath day when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.
Then the Pharisees also began to ask him how he had received his sight. He said to them, &#34He put mud on my eyes. Then I washed, and now I see.&#34
Some of the Pharisees said, &#34This man is not from God, for he does not observe the sabbath.&#34 But others said, &#34How can a man who is a sinner perform such signs?&#34 And they were divided.
So they said again to the blind man, &#34What do you say about him? It was your eyes he opened.&#34 He said, &#34He is a prophet.&#34
The Jews did not believe that he had been blind and had received his sight until they called the parents of the man who had received his sight
and asked them, &#34Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?&#34
His parents answered, &#34We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
but we do not know how it is that now he sees, nor do we know who opened his eyes. Ask him; he is of age. He will speak for himself.&#34
His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that anyone who confessed Jesus to be the Messiah would be put out of the synagogue.
Therefore his parents said, &#34He is of age; ask him.&#34
So for the second time they called the man who had been blind, and they said to him, &#34Give glory to God! We know that this man is a sinner.&#34
He answered, &#34I do not know whether he is a sinner. One thing I do know, that though I was blind, now I see.&#34
They said to him, &#34What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?&#34
He answered them, &#34I have told you already, and you would not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become his disciples?&#34
Then they reviled him, saying, &#34You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
We know that God has spoken to Moses, but as for this man, we do not know where he comes from.&#34
The man answered, &#34Here is an astonishing thing! You do not know where he comes from, and yet he opened my eyes.
We know that God does not listen to sinners, but he does listen to one who worships him and obeys his will.
Never since the world began has it been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a person born blind.
If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.&#34
They answered him, &#34You were born entirely in sins, and are you trying to teach us?&#34 And they drove him out.
Jesus heard that they had driven him out, and when he found him, he said, &#34Do you believe in the Son of Man?&#34
He answered, &#34And who is he, sir? Tell me, so that I may believe in him.&#34
Jesus said to him, &#34You have seen him, and the one speaking with you is he.&#34
He said, &#34Lord, I believe.&#34 And he worshiped him.
Jesus said, &#34I came into this world for judgment so that those who do not see may see, and those who do see may become blind.&#34
Some of the Pharisees near him heard this and said to him, &#34Surely we are not blind, are we?&#34
Jesus said to them, &#34If you were blind, you would not have sin. But now that you say, &#39We see,&#39 your sin remains.
